intro: Alomia callosa, commonly known as the roughleaf alomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush habitats. Alomia callosa is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
